1. Keep track of inventory levels regularly: Shopkeepers should keep regular checks on inventory levels to identify any excess stock. This will help retailers to minimize waste by making adjustments towards the stock order.

2. Train Staff for proper handling: Retail staff should be trained on the proper handling of products and inventory to minimize losses caused by damage, spoilage or theft.

3. Use Inventory Management System: Implementing an inventory management system will help you track all the stocks and tell you the exact quantity of products that you have so that you can avoid oversupply or undersupply. 

4. Monitor sales trends: Monitor sales trends and adjust inventory accordingly. This will help shopkeepers not to lose inventory due to changing demand.

5. Reduce packaging waste: Reducing the packaging waste will help to save the environment as well as reduce the cost of disposable items.

6. Analyze Customer Feedback: Analyzing customer feedback will help the shopkeepers to understand the customer’s purchasing habits and preferences enabling them to acquire stock accordingly. 

7. Perform Regular stock checks: Conducting regular stock checks enables shopkeepers to identify any discrepancies in inventory levels and take necessary steps to reduce losses. 

8. Implement Smart Buying Strategies: It is essential to purchase smart, buy in bulk or during peak season discount promotions to minimize stock costs.

9. Review and audit financial statements: Regular auditing and reviewing financial statements will help shopkeepers in identifying financial losses and plan for remedial measures accordingly. 

10. Offer Discounts or Promotions: Retailers can offer discounts and promotions on overstocked products, which will encourage customers to purchase more, thereby reducing surplus inventory levels.
